content.title: Unit 1. Hello everybody! am/is/are; my/her/his/her; Everyday objects; Numbers; Hello and goodbye
Unit 2. Meeting people. am/is/are - questions and negatives; Possessive's; Family; Opposites; In a cafe
Unit 3. The world of work. he/she/it; Questions and negatives; Jobs; What time is it?
Unit 4. Take it easy! Present Simple 2; I/you/we/they; Leisure activities; Social expressions

5.2. Position of things in a room
5.3. A dialog between Helen and Bob
5.4. Position of things, my daily routine
Unit 6. Can you speak English? can/can't/could/couldn't; was/were; Words that sound the same; On the phone
6.4. What I can and what can't
Unit 7. Then and now. Past Simple 1 - regular verbs; Irregular verbs; Silent letters; Special occasions
7.4. I worked from 6 a.m until 10 p.m.

7.8. What do I remember of the nineties

Unit 9. Food you like! Count and uncount nouns; I like/I'd like; much/many; Food; Polite requests
9.2. Would you like some tea or coffee?
Unit 10. Bigger and better! Comparatives and superlatives; have got; Town and country; Directions 2

10.3. Why did you leave London? You had a good job
Unit 11. Looking good! Present Continuous; Whose; Clothes; Words that rhyme; In a closes shop

Unit 13. How terribly clever! Question forms; Adverbs and adjectives; Describing feelings; Catching a train

Unit 14. Have you ever? Present perfect + ever, never, yet, and just; At the airport
14.3. Yes, I’ve lived in a foreign country
14.6. British Airways flight BA 516 to Geneva
